Description: These grey a-Si BIPV panels mimic a standard rain screen cladding system and can be configured in many shapes and sizes. While a-Si has reached a point in the market where other thin films are seen as more productive and valuable many companies still produce market-ready a-Si based BIPV products.
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Calculated from mean of South,East,West irradiance on skins ([1045+754+735]/3) for CHF applied to 470sqm of fa�cade that yields 27000kWh-a
ignore_GWP Notes: Applies a coefficient to the GWP for standard a-Si. The coefficient is dervied from the ratio between standard CIGS and BIPV CIGS

Description: These glass-glass construction BIPV panels hold polycrystalline cells with a colored film to allow them to mimic more common building materials. This has a slight reduciton on efficiency but is often cited in reviews of BIPV aesthetics as beneficial.
ignore_Cost Notes: Install cost for CHF calculated from https://doi.org/10.1016/j.energy.2020.117935

Description: This white solar panel consists of a film deposited above a collection of monocrystalline cells. The white film brings about a clear reduction in module performance, but provides a very desriable finish for the modules on the whole.

Description: These monocrystalline BIPV products come in a variety of tints that make them very suitable for retrofit projects.
ignore_Cost Notes: Cost calculated based on coefficient dervied from ratio of a-Si integrated and a-Si attached (proxy for labor) applied to base monocrystalline cost
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Derived from STC on Power Rating

Description: This is a standard facade panel system based on a monocrystalline cell construction. It can be easily applied in new construction and retrofit situations.
ignore_Cost Notes: Cost calculated based on coefficient dervied from ratio of a-Si integrated and a-Si attached (proxy for labor) applied to base monocrystalline cost plus the difference between the Tinted Poly roof and fa�cade panels (Proxy for fa�cade install premium)
ignore_Efficiency Notes: Derived from STC on Power Rating
